title: Manchester City’s Aymeric Laporte out for up to six months with knee injury
text:
Manchester City could be without Aymeric Laporte until March after Pep Guardiola said the defender may be out for six months following knee surgery. The Frenchman damaged the cartilage and lateral meniscus of his right knee in the 4-0 win over Brighton & Hove Albion at the end of last month.

Guardiola said: “It will be long – five or six months, January or February maybe – next year for sure.” In Laporte’s absence John Stones may partner Nicolás Otamendi for Saturday’s trip to Norwich City.

Meanwhile Guardiola dismissed the claim of Gareth Southgate, the England manager, that Raheem Sterling has every chance of elevating himself to the level of Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi.

“I’m so happy for him, for the way he’s playing here and national team,” City’s manager said. “But hopefully he won’t read or listen to these kind of things. Nobody can compare with Cristiano or Messi. I don’t know if [Sterling] is the best in England. He has an incredible work ethic and is a nice guy. I’m delighted for him.”
description: Manchester City could be without Aymeric Laporte until March after Pep Guardiola said the defender may be out for six months with a knee injury
